reviews.review_text: The same that Nuclear Dawn, awsome games but deadly, In Nuclear dawn can got some players in servers sometimes, but in Madballs dont got any player anytime, is too sad. Is a great game, great fun, great story, and good gameplay, I recomend it, and if anyone want a mulpiplayer game, tell me, and we can got fun there.

very nice game, very addictive and lots and lots of multiplayer possibility : coop, ctf, survival etc ... the campagne is also very nice and interresting . it will give you lots of pleasure for hours . for the price you cannot go wrong.

An imaginative way to portray a male's pubescent years and growing into adulthood. Assume this game is representative of a pepperoni-face Acne infested teen who has no friends because there is no online community anymore.
Simple arcade shooter with neat graphics and decent music. Single player gameplay isn't as intense as I'd like it to be. Multiplayer probably was awesome, but currently is dead (2015).
Although moderately fun in its concept, the game gets repetitive pretty fast. It doesn't have the uniqueness that you would expect. A fine game but there are better out there.
First there was Robotron, Then there was Smash TV, and now we have... Madballs? Yeah. Its pretty much a fantastic 8 directional overhead shooter to play with your friends, or against.

An uninteresting Dungeonland-Dull top down move-and-shoot with tons of pointless DLC ripe for the scammin'. I hope there's no one playing the online vs mode for the sake of humanity's time well spent. Don't worry. I'm sure no one has ever played this besides me. Don't tell me otherwise.
This was a fun game. I have more time logged than Steam is showing.
horrible horrible horrible mouse control and movement.
The maddest game about balls you'll ever play
I like this game so much I bought 4 copies. Does anyone want a copy?  2/10
Great game with really responsive tight controls, its a shame the multiplayer is dead. Would love a sequel.

Goofy game for sure. You're like a weird ball of goo or somethin and you roll around shooting things and making things explode. It's kind of fun but it will probably go unplayed for long periods of time. Keeping that in mind, I'll recommend this just incase your internet goes out. It's worth a look.
